CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1958, pg, A3, reads: "Rib Fans and Chow Line - The smell of barbecued ribs was the order of the day at South Park's Sully's Grove on Sunday, when factions of the United Steelworkers of American made 'peace' at a picnic arranged by members of the 'rank and file' and 'fair share' groups...Over 300 steelworkers and their families enjoyed the picnic spread, which included fried chicken, roast beef, baked ham, corned beef, potato salad, fruit, beer beans and many other items. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men lined up at tables of food, with trays of fruit, foil covered roaster, and beverage urn, at United Steelworkers of America picnic at Sully's Grove, South Park
